elements.description:
Creates a header for Predix UI demo pages.

##### Usage

    <px-demo-header
        module-name="px-calendar-picker"
        description="The px-calendar-picker component includes various elements used for structuring responsive layouts. This component allows the user to select a date or date range. The main use of this component is to be used in the px-range-panel.">
    </px-demo-header>

properties.name: source
properties.description: Name of the source file to analyze to generate the API viewer.

properties.name: apiSourceFilePath
properties.description:
A string holding the path of the api source file e.g. px-tabs/px-tabs-api.json
x

properties.name: hide
properties.description:
An array which contains the names of properties which will be removed
from the hydrolysis object

properties.name: markPrivate
properties.description:
An array which contains the names of properties which will be marked
as private

properties.name: markReadOnly
properties.description:
An array which contains the names of properties which will be marked
as readonly

properties.name: changeDescription
properties.description:
an array which contains the names and new descriptions of
properties we want to change the deccription of.

properties.name: filterTagByPrefix
properties.description: represents a prefix that we filter the elements by when we mutate the hydrolysis object.

attributes.name: source
attributes.description: Name of the source file to analyze to generate the API viewer.

attributes.name: api-source-file-path
attributes.description:
A string holding the path of the api source file e.g. px-tabs/px-tabs-api.json
x

attributes.name: hide
attributes.description:
An array which contains the names of properties which will be removed
from the hydrolysis object

attributes.name: mark-private
attributes.description:
An array which contains the names of properties which will be marked
as private

attributes.name: mark-read-only
attributes.description:
An array which contains the names of properties which will be marked
as readonly

attributes.name: change-description
attributes.description:
an array which contains the names and new descriptions of
properties we want to change the deccription of.

attributes.name: filter-tag-by-prefix
attributes.description: represents a prefix that we filter the elements by when we mutate the hydrolysis object.

elements.description:
Wraps around `px-code-editor` to provide a code editor instance that can be
used to edit complex props.

##### Usage

    <px-demo-code-editor></px-demo-code-editor>

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Makes the editor visible to the user.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Title to show over the top of the editor.

properties.name: target
properties.description:
The element to attach the `px-demo-props-code-edit-request` event
listener to. Defaults to this element's parent node.

methods.name: _handleEditRequest
methods.description:
When another element requests an editor instance, configure the instance
and make it visible.

attributes.name: enabled
attributes.description: Makes the editor visible to the user.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: Title to show over the top of the editor.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description:
The element to attach the `px-demo-props-code-edit-request` event
listener to. Defaults to this element's parent node.

elements.description:
Creates a container for a collection of demos.

### Usage

    <px-demo-collection></px-demo-collection>

properties.name: demos
properties.description:
A list of demo pages to make available. An array of objects, each with
the name of a demo, and the name of the custom element loaded holding
the demo.

properties.name: chosenDemoName
properties.description:
The name of the active demo. Can be set to update the currently visible
demo, or listened to for notifications when the user changes the
active demo.

properties.name: _decks
properties.description:
An array of objects formatted for the `px-deck-selector` instance.
This helps the user switch between demos.

`px-deck-selector` expects this data format:

    [{"id":"1","name":"Overview","url":"/overview"}]

properties.name: _selectedDeck
properties.description: The currently selected deck, notified out from `px-deck-selector`.

methods.name: _setInitialDemo
methods.description: When the component is first initialized, ensures an active demo is set.

methods.name: _handleChosenDemoNameChange
methods.description:
When the `chosenDemoName` is changed, update the visible demo on the
screen to keep it in sync.

methods.name: _findDemoByName
methods.description: Finds a demo object by its name.

methods.name: _findDeckByName
methods.description: Finds a deck object by its name.

methods.name: _createDemoNode
methods.description:
Creates a demo node inside of a `px-demo-goes-here` tag for insertion
into the DOM.

methods.name: _showDemo
methods.description:
Loops over all the demos in the DOM. Ensures that `chosenDemoName` is
visible and all other demos are hidden.

methods.name: _computeDecks
methods.description: Builds the `_decks` array from the `demos` source format.

methods.name: _handleSelectedDeckChange
methods.description:
When the selected deck is changed by the user, handle the change and
update the `currentDemoName`.

methods.name: _isInitialDeck
methods.description:
Checks if this is the initial demo. Useful to determine if we should
show "back to initial-demo-name-here" link in header.

methods.name: _handleBackToInitial
methods.description:
When the user taps the 'Back to [initial-demo-name-here]' link, set the
`chosenDemoName` to the `selectedDeck`.

methods.name: _syncChosenDemoContext
methods.description: Ensures the `chosenDemoName` is reflected in the context browser.

attributes.name: demos
attributes.description:
A list of demo pages to make available. An array of objects, each with
the name of a demo, and the name of the custom element loaded holding
the demo.

attributes.name: chosen-demo-name
attributes.description:
The name of the active demo. Can be set to update the currently visible
demo, or listened to for notifications when the user changes the
active demo.

elements.description:
Wraps around `px-demo-snippet` to show code sample.

##### Usage

    <px-demo-component-snippet></px-demo-component-snippet>

properties.name: elementName
properties.description: Name of the Predix UI element.

properties.name: elementProperties
properties.description: Description of the Predix UI module.

properties.name: linksIncludes
properties.description: An array of <link> include URLs required to make the CodePen work.

properties.name: scriptsIncludes
properties.description: An array of <script> include URLs required to make the CodePen work.

properties.name: polygitIncludes
properties.description: An array of additional PolyGit includes required to make the CodePen work.

properties.name: codepenLink
properties.description: Link to a pre-created Codepen that we do not need to dynamically build.

properties.name: _shallowProps
properties.description: Props computed to the format `px-demo-snippet` accepts.

methods.name: _assignShallowProps
methods.description:
Converts the complex `props` object into a shallow format of
`propName`:`propValue` for `px-demo-snippet`.

attributes.name: element-name
attributes.description: Name of the Predix UI element.

attributes.name: element-properties
attributes.description: Description of the Predix UI module.

attributes.name: links-includes
attributes.description: An array of <link> include URLs required to make the CodePen work.

attributes.name: scripts-includes
attributes.description: An array of <script> include URLs required to make the CodePen work.

attributes.name: polygit-includes
attributes.description: An array of additional PolyGit includes required to make the CodePen work.

attributes.name: codepen-link
attributes.description: Link to a pre-created Codepen that we do not need to dynamically build.

elements.description:
Displays a list of configs that the user can choose from to set the demo's
configurable options.

##### Usage

        <px-demo-configs configs="{{configs}}" chosen-config="{{chosenConfig}}">
        </px-demo-configs>

properties.name: configs
properties.description:
A list of configs that can be selected by the user. Will be displayed
as a list of tabs.

properties.name: chosenConfig
properties.description: The currently-selected config, returned as as an object.

properties.name: props
properties.description:
The `props` that the user can configure. When the `chosenConfig` is
updated, any values defined there will be applied to `props`

When any of the `props` values are changed, a new version of the config
is saved so that when the user returns to this config, the options
they selected are restored.

properties.name: _selectedTab
properties.description:
The index of the currently-selected option. When this is updated,
`chosenConfig` will be updated with the corresponding object.

properties.name: _userConfigs
properties.description: An internal representation of the state of a particular configuration.

methods.name: applyPropDefaults
methods.description:
On first run, copy each prop's `defaultValue` to its `value`. If you
need to add props dynamically, you can call this method manually on the
`px-demo-props` instance. Passing `overwriteValue` as `true` will reset
the props to their default value.

params.name: overwriteValue
params.description: If `true`, will write the default to value even if the value is already defined

methods.name: _createUserConfigs
methods.description:
Converts all developer-supplied `configs` and copies them to a `_userConfigs`
representation that can be changed by the user.

Whenever the user changes a prop with a config selected, the current state
of the config is saved. If a user leaves the config and returns to it later,
the config state will be restored.

methods.name: _indexPlusOne
methods.description: Returns the next index.

methods.name: _findConfigName
methods.description:
Attempts to find a `configName` for the item. If there is no name, returns
a string like 'Option 1'.

methods.name: _setChosenConfig
methods.description: When the user selects a tab, sets the `chosenConfig` to a corresponding value.

methods.name: _updateProps
methods.description:
When the `chosenConfig` is reset, iterate over its values and set the
`props` to the new values.

methods.name: _hasConfigs
methods.description: Determines if any `configs` were defined.

methods.name: _updateUserConfigProps
methods.description:
Whenever the user changes a prop with a config selected, save the current
state of the config. If a user leaves this config and returns to it later,
the config state will be restored.

params.name: propChangeInfo
params.description: Object emitted by the complex change listener watching deep paths in `props`

attributes.name: configs
attributes.description:
A list of configs that can be selected by the user. Will be displayed
as a list of tabs.

attributes.name: chosen-config
attributes.description: The currently-selected config, returned as as an object.

attributes.name: props
attributes.description:
The `props` that the user can configure. When the `chosenConfig` is
updated, any values defined there will be applied to `props`

When any of the `props` values are changed, a new version of the config
is saved so that when the user returns to this config, the options
they selected are restored.

elements.description:
Creates a footer for Predix UI demo pages.

##### Usage

    <px-demo-footer></px-demo-footer>

Component container code for Predix UI demos.

##### Usage

    <px-demo-interactive>
    </px-demo-interactive>

properties.name: propsShouldBeVisible
properties.description: If true, make sure the props container is shown. If false, hide it.

methods.name: _ensurePropsContainerVisible
methods.description:
When the `px-demo-props` component notifies that some props are visible,
make sure the properties container is visible.

methods.name: _ensurePropsContainerHidden
methods.description:
When the `px-demo-props` component notifies that no props are visible,
make sure the properties container is hidden.

methods.name: _demoComponentLightDomLoaded
methods.description:
gets called when the light dom for demo-component is loaded, and fires
an event.

attributes.name: props-should-be-visible
attributes.description: If true, make sure the props container is shown. If false, hide it.

elements.description:
Creates inputs for configuration props.

##### Usage

        <px-demo-props></px-demo-props>

properties.name: props
properties.description:
An object with keys describing the name of a possible input, the expected
return value type, the choices, and the input to show.

properties.name: config
properties.description:
The currently-chosen config. When this property is updated, any
props defined in the config will be updated in the fields.

properties.name: propsVisible
properties.description: Indicates if any props are currently visible.

properties.name: _fields
properties.description: An array of field names to be mounted in the DOM.

properties.name: _fieldsIndex
properties.description: An index of `_fields` entries by `propName`.

methods.name: applyPropDefaults
methods.description:
On first run, copy each prop's `defaultValue` to its `value`. If you
need to add props dynamically, you can call this method manually on the
`px-demo-props` instance. Passing `overwriteValue` as `true` will reset
the props to their default value.

params.name: overwriteValue
params.description: If `true`, will write the default to value even if the value is already defined

methods.name: _computeFields
methods.description: Extracts all field names to iterate over in a `dom-repeat`.

methods.name: _itIs
methods.description: Convenience method for comparing two references in a dom-if template.

methods.name: _itIsOneOf
methods.description:
Convenience method for checking if a references in a dom-if template exists
in an array.

methods.name: _itIsTrue
methods.description: Convenience method for checking if a reference in a dom-if is true.

methods.name: _itIsDisabled
methods.description: Convenience method for checking if toggle is disabled and returning appropriate class.

methods.name: _getFieldLabel
methods.description: Returns the public name for the prop that should be shown to the user

params.name: field
params.description: The key of the property in the `props` object

methods.name: _getFieldPlaceholder
methods.description:
Returns the `field.inputPlaceholder` or an empty string if placeholder
is not defined.

methods.name: _formatInputLabel
methods.description:
Converts a camel-case string like 'isReallyNice' to a regular string
like 'Is Really Nice'.

methods.name: _getDropdownDisplayValue
methods.description:
Retrieves the value to show for the dropdown element. If the current `dropdownVal` is
not defined or an empty string, sets the display value to "Select".

methods.name: _handleTextInput
methods.description: Binds a text input event to the prop.value it should change.

methods.name: _handleNumberInput
methods.description: Binds a text input event to the prop.value it should change.

methods.name: _handleToggleInput
methods.description: Binds a toggle input event to the prop.value it should change.

methods.name: _handleDropdownInput
methods.description: Binds a dropdown input event to the prop.value it should change.

methods.name: _handleTypeaheadItemSelected
methods.description: Binds a typeahead selected event to the prop.value it should change.

methods.name: _handleCodeEditButton
methods.description: Binds to a click on a code edit button.

methods.name: _syncToProp
methods.description: Sync a value from a field to a prop.

params.name: propName
params.description: Name of prop, will also be its key in `props` object

params.name: newVal
params.description: The updated value to set for the prop

methods.name: _syncToField
methods.description: Sync a value from a prop to a field.

params.name: propChangeInfo
params.description: Object emitted by the complex change listener watching deep paths in `props`

methods.name: _propIsVisible
methods.description: Determines if a prop should be shown.

methods.name: _handleConfigUpdate
methods.description:
When the user's chosen `config` changes, attempt to update the visibility
of each prop if the config shows/hides any.

methods.name: _setEachPropVisibility
methods.description:
Loops through all fields and shows/hides depending on the configuration
of the function.

If `behavior` is 'showOnly', hides everything except what is in `propList`.
If `behavior` is 'hideOnly', shows everything except what is in `propList`.
If `behavior` is 'showAll', shows everything and ignores prop list.

params.name: behavior
params.description: How the function should show/hide things, choose from 'showOnly', 'hideOnly', 'showAll'

params.name: propList
params.description: Array of string-y names for each prop

methods.name: _handlePropsVisibleChange
methods.description:
When the `propsVisible` attribute is updated, send a manual notification
out to the world.

attributes.name: props
attributes.description:
An object with keys describing the name of a possible input, the expected
return value type, the choices, and the input to show.

attributes.name: config
attributes.description:
The currently-chosen config. When this property is updated, any
props defined in the config will be updated in the fields.

attributes.name: props-visible
attributes.description: Indicates if any props are currently visible.

elements.description:
Creates a header for Predix UI demo pages.

##### Usage

    <px-demo-header
        module-name="px-calendar-picker"
        description="The px-calendar-picker component includes various elements used for structuring responsive layouts. This component allows the user to select a date or date range. The main use of this component is to be used in the px-range-panel.">
    </px-demo-header>

properties.name: moduleName
properties.description: Name of the Predix UI module.

properties.name: description
properties.description: Description of the Predix UI module.

properties.name: hideShields
properties.description:
Hides the shields (i.e. the images that show the current bower tag,
issues, and more). Useful if you don't need them or can't get them.

properties.name: parentName
properties.description:
Sets the name of the topmost parent component, which will be used to
build the shield links. Optional, leave it blank to use the `moduleName`.

properties.name: _shieldName
properties.description:
The computed name for the shields. If `parentName` is defined and has
length, it takes precedence. Then `moduleName` is used by default.

properties.name: desktop
properties.description: Whether the component is optimized for desktop.

properties.name: tablet
properties.description: Whether the component is optimized for tablet.

properties.name: mobile
properties.description: Whether the component is optimized for mobile.

methods.name: _computeShieldName
methods.description:
Computes the `_shieldName`. Tries to use the `parentName`, then falls
back to `moduleName`.

attributes.name: module-name
attributes.description: Name of the Predix UI module.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: Description of the Predix UI module.

attributes.name: hide-shields
attributes.description:
Hides the shields (i.e. the images that show the current bower tag,
issues, and more). Useful if you don't need them or can't get them.

attributes.name: parent-name
attributes.description:
Sets the name of the topmost parent component, which will be used to
build the shield links. Optional, leave it blank to use the `moduleName`.

attributes.name: desktop
attributes.description: Whether the component is optimized for desktop.

attributes.name: tablet
attributes.description: Whether the component is optimized for tablet.

attributes.name: mobile
attributes.description: Whether the component is optimized for mobile.

elements.description: Partials, style modules and helpers for creating demo pages for Predix UI components. ### Usage Click here to increment counter:{{counterValue}}

properties.name: counterValue
properties.description: This property keeps track of the number of clicks.

methods.name: handleClick
methods.description: Handles click on the element defined in 'on-click' on the template.

methods.name: increment
methods.description: Increments the counter

attributes.name: counter-value
attributes.description: This property keeps track of the number of clicks.
